featured.text: They are brave enough to help in an emergency while others may stand by.
Over the years, the fearless tribesmen have stood strong against slavery, and resisted the urging of the Kenyan and Tanzanian governments to adopt a more modern lifestyle.
Rising more than 5,000 feet, Mt. Waialeale stands at the center of the nearly round island.
Every Taiwanese student should know what ‘M.I.T.’ stands for.
There, time almost stands still, and horse-drawn carts outnumber motor vehicles.

other.text: Standing on the seashore, we saw a of seagulls flying over the ocean before they glided down and settled on the water.
Small amounts of regular activity, even just standing and moving around, throughout the day is enough to bring the increased levels back down.
They tend to stand or move around less on days they work out.
The remedy is as simple as standing up and taking activity breaks.
A long-standing tradition in the UK.
Memorial poles stood in front of a house.
Kevin had been standing on a ladder trying to reach for a book on the top shelf when he lost his and fell to the ground.

definition.zh_def: 站立；保持某種位置或狀態
definition.en_def: To be in an upright position on the feet; to remain in a specified state or condition.
definition.example: Please stand up when the teacher enters the room.
